item.title: Leaf litter decomposing without clearance for months, 12th January
item.description:
This pathway is used by hundreds of school children every day during the week and hasn't been cleared for months since the start of autumn. Unfortunately this has led to a slow decomposition of the leaf litter on this pathway and causes unnecessary hazards to form. During wet days this becomes the decomposing organic matter becomes difficult to navigate through (especially for 4-5 year old children) and on colder days, this pathway ices over - it then becomes very slippery to walk over.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Barnfield Wood Road, Park Langley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside 75 Victoria Road, NW6 6TB, 12th January
item.description:
Dear Brent Council Team, I am writing in response to report reference 8576046. I am disappointed with the response sent on 7/1/2026 simply stating - 'under intervention level' - I'd like clarification on how this conclusion was reached? Specifically, please can you confirm: 1) Was the tree inspected in person? If so, on what date and by which department? 2) What criteria were used to assess the tree, pavement, and road condition? As outlined in my original report, the damage is visible, worsening over time and presenting accessibility issues for pedestrians, pushchairs and less mobile residents. Water regularly pools around the base of the tree and along the road edge, often taking days to drain, which further degrades the surface and increases risk. I am also seeking clarity on why this tree was not assessed alongside the tree on the opposite side of the road, which was removed by the council the previous week. Given the proximity and apparent similarity in impact, it is difficult to understand how one tree warranted removal while this one is deemed below intervention level. I look forward to your response and would appreciate a more detailed explanation of the decision-making process and any next steps. Best wishes, Emily
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Victoria Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet
